name: SAVE - THE HOMELESS
description:
This is a 3d work I do in Blender3d back in 2016, commemorating habitat day. Thanks to blockchain tech I can sell this as digital token.

Sumatra was once a green, tropical paradise that helped Indonesia earn the nickname “Emerald of the Equator.” No more.

The natural forests that harbored some of the world’s highest biodiversity have been largely replaced by two trees: oil palms and acacia. Palm oil and pulp for paper are flooding global markets from Sumatra, the world’s sixth largest island.

Sumatra lost forest at an average rate of 0.46 million hectares per year (1.8%). With the devastating deforestation rate, animals are loosing home and prey, in the brink of extinction.

SAVE initiative - 70% Part of this OBJKT sales will go to WWF INDONESIA to help the conservation effort of the Sumatran tiger (Panthera tigris sondaica). There are less than 400 of these majestic creatures are left in the world.
Stand with Me.
